title: Shane Ritchie gets BARRED from nightclub after refusing to take his hat off - and even his own son is embarrassed
text:
They say blood is thicker than water - and that certainly rang true for Shane Richie and his family on Friday night. 
The 52 year-old TV presenter was left fuming after a Malvern nightclub refused him entry for wearing a hat - and swiftly aired his displeasure via social media platform, Twitter. 
Uploading an image of the venue, the Malvern Lounge, the former EastEnders star posted: 'Alert! All touring companies coming to Malvern give Malvern lounge a swerve STAY AWAY !!! Turned away for wearing a hat !!!'. 
Before long, his eldest son Shane was quick to stand up for him. Wading into the spat, the aspiring musician posted a very sarcastic message which read: 'Rules are rules Dad'. 
Richie then replied with: 'No f**ker in there!'. Shane offered some sarcastic support to his famous father (Photo: ShaneNolan/Twitter) Shane Jr appears to be equally cheeky - just like his father (Photo: ITV) 
Others were equally vocal. Seeming to miss the obvious comedy content, one fan responded: 'come on young Shane it's a hat,it's winter,it's a pub not Buckingham palace It's ur dad'. 
Nolan then added: 'Yeah, always winds me up if the place is dead to be fair'. 
Sadly, his contribution didn't temper Shane's annoyance, which continued to manifest on his newsfeed. 
Responding to critics who suggested he simply remove his hat, he spat back: 'No I won't. Was very embarrassing. All the cast turned up to celebrate the great time we've had in Malvern'. 
When a local councillor posted: 'A rule is a rule - and Malvern is a wonderful place!' he responded: 'Totally agree but I'd just walked in from out of the cold ....he just wanted to show off in front of staff X'. 
He even posted an image of himself with Laura Whitmore in faux outrage. 'The hat that offended management at Malvern lounge. Wouldn't mind but it was bleedin' empty!'.
